definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To match (something or someone which one currently perceives) to a memory of some previous encounter with the same person or thing.
examples: I recognized his face immediately, although his voice was different.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To acknowledge the existence or legality of; to treat as valid or worthy of consideration.
examples: The US and a number of EU countries are expected to recognize Kosovo on Monday.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , or with clause ) To acknowledge or consider (as being a certain thing or having a certain quality or property).
examples: Slavery is widely recognized as immoral.
I recognize that my behaviour has been unacceptable.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To realize or discover the nature of something; apprehend quality in.
( transitive ) To show formal appreciation of, as with an award, commendation etc.
examples: His services were recognized in a testimonial.
The soldier was recognized in dispatches.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) To review ; to examine again.
( immunology ) To have the property to bind to specific antigens.
